User Interface Design

The core service I provide is bringing expressing brands online. Like a PR makeover, your brand and message get shown in the best light possible.

I helped build a pattern library to use across all clients at my agency. Each website gets a different feel with different services emphasized, while being quick to build. I’m up to 300+ custom sites over the last 6 years.

Background:

  1. Style guides

    2. Paragraph about how important a logo is for small businesses.

  2. Research

    3. Maintaining an Evernote collection of design ideas for the 6 years at my job.

    My goto for design ideas, before even going to dribbble.

  3. Critique

    4. Goals?

    Goals? Previous wins? How else to illustrate critiques?.

3 examples final product

  • Role: design
  • Deliverables: 2 templates - homepage & subpage; plus interactions
  • Collaborators: client, content writer, developer, project manager
  • Goals: represent the brand, optimized to convert, doesn’t stray from pattern library
  • Clients: medium-sized (3M-20M) contracting companies of Plumbers, HVAC Technicians, and Electricians.
  • Process as equation: provided files + video call with client + design the thing + design critique + present to client + multiple rounds + dev QC = launched website.

Nautical-Themed HVAC

My agency didn’t offer branding, so I have lots of experience making sub-par logos shine. Charter, on the other hand, had a fresh rebrand, which helped me tell their story.
